name: rampantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is uncontrolled and increasing quickly, especially in a negative way: Wild garlic grows rampantly in the countryside here. Our culture often seems selfish and rampantly obsessed with consumption.
More examplesFewer examplesTo many people who met him, he came across as rampantly confrontational. Many players share his worries about an increasingly commercialized and rampantly competitive system.In good, hot summers, this herb will grow rampantly, but it may need support if there is much wind.These politicians are often rampantly opposed to wind farms.
